title: ESPN's Paul Finebaum says he won't run for Alabama Senate seat

description: Related video: DC Bureau: Immigration Changes after Natl Guard Shooting The man accused of shooting two National Guard members in Washington, D.C., killing one of them, has been formally charged with offenses including murder and assault, court filings show. description: President Trump on Tuesday said his administration was planning to overhaul Dulles International Airport in Virginia “We’re also going to rebuild Dulles airport because it’s not a good airport. It should be a great airport, and it’s not a good airport at all," Trump said during a Cabinet meeting. "It’s a terrible airport. It was...
title: Trump says his administration will ‘rebuild’ Dulles airport

description: The accounts, available in 2026, are meant to give the youngest Americans a head start, financially. But not every child qualifies for the seed money.
title: Who qualifies for $1K or $250 contributions to their 'Trump accounts' after $6.25B donation

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Conservative activist Laura Loomer on Monday accused the office of Army Secretary Dan Driscoll of trying to oust Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth in an alleged “coup.” Hegseth's leadership has been repeatedly questioned after several scandals including texting about war plans in a Signal group chat and allegedly ordering illegal strikes on boats in the Caribbean....
title: Loomer: Army secretary's office plotting 'coup' against Hegseth

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Former Honduras President Juan Orlando Hernández was released from prison Monday after President Trump pardoned him of charges related to assisting drug traffickers. "After nearly four years of pain, waiting, and difficult trials, my husband Juan Orlando Hernández RETURNED to being a free man, thanks to the presidential pardon granted by President Donald Trump," former...
title: Former Honduras President Juan Orlando Hernández released from prison after Trump pardon

author: Julia Shapero
description: The Trump administration plans to take a $150 million stake in xLight, a startup developing laser technology to advance semiconductor manufacturing.  The Commerce Department said Monday that it has signed a non-binding preliminary letter of intent to provide federal incentives to the startup under the CHIPS and Science Act in exchange for equity.  The company xLight, which counts former Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger...
title: Trump administration taking $150M stake in chip startup

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Former Wisconsin Lt. Gov. Mandela Barnes (D) unveiled his bid for governor on Tuesday, joining a crowded Democratic field looking to succeed retiring Gov. Tony Evers (D) next year.  “Seems like the harder you work, the more Washington looks the other way. Lower taxes for billionaires, higher prices for working people,” Barnes said in his launch ad. “Under Trump,...
title: Democrat Mandela Barnes unveils bid for Wisconsin governor

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Monday said the Trump administration is investigating claims that tax money from Minnesota went to the terrorist organization Al-Shabaab, which is based in Somalia. Bessent, in a post on social platform X, said he ordered the probe after finding the North Star State's tax funds went to Al-Shabaab "under the...
title: Treasury investigating whether Minnesota tax money went to terrorist organization

description: President Trump will convene his Cabinet on Tuesday morning, amid controversy over Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth's role in ordering in a Caribbean strike that killed two survivors of an initial hit on their boat. Hegseth, who reportedly directed for the mission to "kill everybody," on Monday night posted his support for the admiral in charge...

description: A battle among Republican lawmakers over the future of U.S. AI policy is threatening to hold up a must-pass annual Defense bill. Lawmakers are wrestling over whether to halt state AI regulations and other thorny AI provisions in final negotiations over the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), one of the heaviest legislative lifts in any...
title: AI showdown splits Republicans in high-stakes NDAA talks

author: Caroline Vakil
description: A Tennessee special election for a House seat in the state’s deep-red 7th Congressional District is teeing up one of the last major electoral tests for Democrats this year as they hope to continue their winning streak ahead of 2026. Republican Matt Van Epps, a former commissioner of the Tennessee Department of General Services, is running against Democratic state Rep....
title: Democrats seek upset in Tennessee special election: 5 things to watch

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Republicans don’t see a bipartisan deal to extend enhanced health insurance premium subsidies coming together before the Christmas deadline, given the complexity of the issue and a growing fight over abortion, an issue that deeply divides both parties. There is a solid group of Republican lawmakers in both the Senate and House who don’t...
title: GOP pessimism grows over any deal to extend expiring health care subsidies

author: Brett Samuels
description: Republicans are showing signs of picking their battles against President Trump, with the administration’s handling of military strikes on alleged drug boats in the Caribbean serving as the latest catalyst. Republicans in Congress have been exceedingly deferential to the White House for much of Trump’s first year back in office, but lawmakers have shown an...
title: Republicans show new signs of independence from Trump

author: Chris Stirewalt
description: Congress returned from its Thanksgiving break to a markedly different world from the one of even just a few weeks ago, when lawmakers passed the current stopgap spending bill that runs until Jan. 21. It’s been a series of ugly news cycles for the majority party since Republicans’ success in getting the government reopened without any...
title: Retirements signal GOP lawmakers delivered for Trump, but not themselves

author: Julia Manchester
description: The fallout over U.S. boat strikes on Venezuela are laying bare rifts within the Republican Party as the situation in the Caribbean intensifies.  President Trump over the weekend confirmed he spoke with the country’s president, Nicolás Maduro, but did not divulge any details from the conversation. The president also declared the closure of Venezuelan airspace,...
title: Rifts over Venezuela boat strikes split GOP

description: The intensifying controversy over Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s role in a fatal Sept. 2 attack on a boat in the Caribbean is raising new, broader questions over the legality of President Trump’s military actions. The administration argues the repeated boat strikes it has carried out in the Caribbean are justified on the basis the U.S....
